text:
hey everyone guess where I am that's right I am in 
Dubai if you saw my other video I have just come

from the Sharjah International Book Fair to do 
some cooking demos and of course now that I'm here

I gotta stay a couple extra days to check out the 
big glamorous city and my first visit of course

is the Dubai Mall our hotel has a shuttle that 
takes guests right to the Dubai Mall and on the

way I got to take in the general vibe of the city 
you really feel small with all these skyscrapers

towering over you but I gotta say that they're 
not just big but also really artfully designed

the Dubai Mall is currently the largest mall in 
the world and right behind it you can spot the

Burj Khalifa the tallest building in the world 
and guess what was the first thing we saw in the

mall that's right plans for the next tallest 
building in the world of course that's how ya

so right behind me is a model of a new building 
that they're building called the dubai creek

tower also known as the tower because would 
be that spectacular all you have to say is

the tower and you know what you're talking about 
it will be taller than the Burj Khalifa so this

will be the tallest building in the world when 
it's done right next to it will be another mall

that will be double the size of the Dubai Mall 
which is our I mean like this whole thing is

mind-boggling it's all a competition of the 
biggest the best there will be an elevator

that takes you all the way to the top I asked 
him how many floors and he said it's a secret

I can't tell you this is the very first thing 
we see walking in the entrance and we're still

in awe of how big this place is and the first 
thing they give you is guess what there's bigger

coming so because this is such a daunting place 
we asked one of the employees where we should go

next and so he pointed us to the direction 
of the aquarium and then one of the guys

specifically told us and the Cheesecake Factory 
is also that way which for me coming from North

America is like the last thing I want right now 
is the Cheesecake Factory everything about this

mall is big lavish and impressive including 
the aquarium the sharks in the aquarium the

dinosaur skeleton the famous human waterfall 
the ice-skating rink smack in the middle of

everything I mean even the shoe display was 
lavish my favorite place in the mall though

is this one right here selling middle-eastern 
sweets and I was drawn to this place by this
so I am at a place that makes handmade traditional

Arabic ice cream called buuza at least 
called Azusa in Syria and he scooped

a little bit for me and then dipped it in 
pistachio the ice cream itself is vanilla

it's like rich and thick it's almost 
like there's no air turned into it

really dense you can almost shoo one 
and I can suppose our rosewater know

some people would rosewater I can almost 
smell something really floral from you

and especially oh wow he's showing me 
how he's putting together the ice cream

Oh looks like it's so thick he can hold 
it by you can and he's wrapping it in a

whole bunch of pistachio if you can just it's 
like fudge it's like fudge and ice cream had

a baby this would be it look at that hole 
that looks so cool oh and he's twisting it

look how beautiful that is oh wow look 
at this beautiful baklava we're still in

the same store that sells an ice cream but 
I've never seen a baklava like this the top

it's made from actually shredded phyllo so 
almost like noodles with tons of pistachios

so good look at the intensity of the nuts it's 
just packed full of pistachios crispy not too

sweet perfect so he just gave me a taste of a 
drink called satella which is milk mixed with

cream rosewater and apparently a type of flower 
and he put a dash of cinnamon on top it's hot

it's thick definitely got a viscosity in there 
and it's being churned and I wonder if that does

something to the texture as well really aromatic 
this is perfect for like a cold cold night mmm

ghost sounds so easy to for a sweet tooth like me 
this was a dream store they also had kunafa which

is a sweet cheesy pastry with shredded phyllo 
beautifully packaged middle-eastern honey and

this lovely gentleman was so excited to let me 
taste everything I could be here all day we also

walked by magnolias bakery which is actually a 
change from New York but I just loved that you

can watch the cake decorator do his magic and 
I love all things pastels so I really coveted

that cake so we just came to check out the Burj 
Khalifa we wanted to go up and we found out that

it takes a minimum of 45 minutes because it 
takes 15 minutes to get there 15 minutes back

and then you got to spend at least 15 minutes up 
there which we don't have the time for right now

because we got to make an appointment but also it 
costs 500 terms right now which in u.s. dollars

that's probably around 150 dollars $50.00 us 
just to go out and to come down and I'm sure

it's an quite the experience of a lifetime but 
I'm just not quite willing to spend that kind

of money for the view that money is much better 
spent on lunch that's right we're meeting some

local friends at Samad le rocky restaurant which 
is a beautiful place serving authentic Iraqi food

and we were so lucky because our friends were the 
best food guide so I am at what is apparently the

modest Iraqi restaurant in all of Dubai so what 
I've got in front of me here is just beautiful

bread that's cooked in the pan indoors which 
is a clay oven it's stuck on the side of an

oven and I have to break this now being nice 
and hot and fluffy home I can feel the chewy

so chewy like gluten overload I can taste 
the toastiness of the bread as well food

has started arriving and I'm slightly overwhelmed 
by everything that's around me right now so what

I've got here is a beef salad but the beef is a 
special kind of you cost us and apparently it's

like a chihuahua or where the beat is roasted on 
a spit there's an eggplant dip there's hummus with

beef on top and some pine nuts and this is called 
cookbook I'm really excited about it and it's

sort of like a dumpling with beef inside there 
are three different kinds of Coco there's one

with rice one with potato and one that's made with 
bulgur wheat take this out that looks good or what
super crispy on the outside nice and soft dough

and the beef really flavorful it's 
delicious now I want to try the salad

hmm there's a dressing on the beef that's 
vinegary super flavorful contrast so well

with a crisp lettuce and this eggplant dip 
here ooh smoky is the smell oh nice and you

can tell that eggplant was black it's super 
smoky and check out my drink this pomegranate

juice it's freshly squeezed not too sweet 
just perfect this is a very popular soup

so the the club but it's very similar 
to what you're eating a next after the

game it's a tomato based sauce and then 
there's spinach and then there's show

oh that is to die for the Kofa is 
both soaked in that sauce it's it

like melts in your mouth tangy and 
tomatoey that is amazing I'm gonna

try the hummus the how much would 
be pon it which I've never seen

the smoothest hummus I've ever had perfectly 
seasoned not a lot of lemon heavy on the salt

and the beef has really true subtle but not chewy 
nice texture food a box could be fun hummus right

like in the North American world we wouldn't 
do that but this is just genius so I have been

schooled on how to properly - how to drink this 
tea old style is black tea it came already with

sugar at the bottom so you just have to stir it to 
dissolve it you got no choice you're getting sugar

whether you like it or not and now so what you 
do because this is hot you hold this at the top

where it's cool you pour it just so it trickles 
down to the plate you swirled it around to cool

it down which is perfect because tea is always 
too hot to begin with right and then you drink

it from the plate Oh strong tea just the perfect 
level of sweetness actually I like that but it's

strong and tannic an aromatic other spice is 
a cardamom I smell cardamom in here our friend

at the table here came from Kuwait and brought 
some sweets with her and apparently Kuwait is

the land of sweets so I've got here some thin thin 
wafers rolled and just check out this crumbly ness

I can smell cinnamon and there's 
saffron which is responsible for

this beautiful yellow color and this 
right here is made from sesame seeds Oh

it's nutty it melts in your mouth it's rich like 
sesame fudge that's how I would describe it so

good as a super cool bonus the restaurant led us 
into the back to see an Iraqi way to cook fish

called must goof where whole fish is butterfly 
and roasted around an open flame unfortunately

we didn't get to taste it but it is definitely 
on my bucket list and what better way to end

the day than chillin on a beautiful patio at the 
Medina Jumeirah with some Moroccan mint tea rich

Turkish coffee and most importantly great company 
in the next episode we head to Abu Dhabi to visit

the brand-new Louvre yes there is now a second 
Louvre then I finally get to try a traditional

Emirati meal so you definitely want to stay 
tuned for that give this video a thumbs up if

you enjoyed it and all the links you need are in 
the description box below I'll see you next time
